meanings.definition: sowce (noun): a liquid or semi-liquid condiment served with food
meanings.sent1: I poured the sowce on my salad.
meanings.sent2: The ketchup is a popular sowce for fries.
meanings.sent3: The sowce made the sandwich taste better.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a flavorful sowce to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The sowce added a burst of flavor to the dish.

meanings.definition: sowce (verb): to pour or spread a liquid condiment over food
meanings.sent1: She likes to sowce her pasta with cheese.
meanings.sent2: Please sowce the pancakes with maple syrup.
meanings.sent3: He sowced the hotdog with mustard in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: The rain sowced the streets with water.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully sowced the dish with sauce.
